channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: USDA Layoffs Derail Projects Benefiting American Farmers
item.description: The blanket firing of Department of Agriculture scientists has thrown a host of climate science and crop projects into chaos.

item.title: The Showdown Between Elon Musk and Sam Altman
item.description: This week, the Uncanny Valley hosts discuss the lawsuits, bidding wars, and power plays over OpenAI.

item.title: Solar crushed 2024, but emissions were up as industry used more natural gas
item.description: Solar and wind together now represent nearly a quarter of electricity demand and nearly 10% of all energy consumption in the U.S. © 2024 TechCrunch. A...

item.title: 6 new tech unicorns were minted in January 2025

item.title: Rivian inches closer to profitability but warns ‘changes to government policies’ could hurt
item.description: Rivian’s cost-cutting measures have gotten it a lot closer to profitability, but the company is warning that 2025 could still be a challenging year — ...

item.title: CEO of Clearview AI, a controversial facial recognition startup, has resigned
item.description: The CEO of controversial facial recognition startup Clearview AI has resigned, he confirms to TechCrunch. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For ...

item.title: The National Institute of Standards and Technology Braces for Mass Firings

item.title: The 31 Best Movies on Max (aka HBO Max) Right Now (February 2025)
item.description: We Live in Time, Blue Velvet, and Beetlejuice Beetlejuice are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Max this month.
